intro: Paullinia obovata subsp. flava, commonly known as the yellow passionvine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow when ripe. This subspecies is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
